title: Brazil creates multi-billion dollar mega-fund to save forests and dominate global sustainability - CPG Click Oil and Gas
text:
Brazil launches R$673 billion fund to save forests, attract investors and lead the future of global sustainability.
Brazil invests in a billion-dollar fund to preserve forests and ensure a sustainable future.
O Brazil will launch this Thursday (6) one of the largest funds of environmental preservation of the planet. Named “Tropical Forests Forever Facility (TFFF)”The program seeks to capture $ 673 billion - about 125 billions of dollars — to protect the tropical forests and boost the The future of global sustainability..
The announcement takes place in Belem (PA), on the eve of COP 30, reinforcing Brazil's leading role in discussions about the environment.
The initiative, led by Lula governmentintends to unite foreign governments and private investors in an unprecedented financial strategy.
The goal is to transform the forest preservation as a long-term economic asset, guaranteeing permanent resources to protect the Amazon biome and other green areas in developing countries.
Fund will pay countries per hectare of preserved forest.
O Tropical Forests Forever Facility It works in a simple but powerful way: countries that maintain deforestation rates below 0,5% per year will receive payments proportional to the hectares preserved.
Thus, the project creates a direct economic incentive for nations to keep their forests standing, transforming the environmental preservation as a sustainable source of income.
According to the government, the proposal is innovative precisely because it offers permanent financial return to those who protect the environment. The idea breaks with the traditional model of one-off donations, creating an investment structure that rewards ongoing care for ecosystems.
Fundraising: R$ 134,6 billion in the first phase.
In the initial phase, Brazil intends to attract $ 134,6 billion along with sponsoring countries willing to assume the initial risks and potential losses. This step will serve as a solid foundation for the subsequent entry of private investors, which should contribute $ 538,4 billion additional, adding the $ 673 billion Dear.
Potential partners include pension funds, sovereign wealth funds and international climate finance agenciesinterested in guaranteeing profitability combined with sustainabilityIn this way, Brazil seeks to unite. preservation and profit, proving that the green future It can also be economically viable.
Estimated annual profit and global impact
According to official projections, the TFFF should generate about BRL 21,5 billion per year in income, benefiting up to 74 emerging countries that maintain effective conservation policies. This structure aims to strengthen international cooperation and consolidate the Brazil as a world leader in sustainability process.
Furthermore, the model can inspire other nations to create similar mechanisms, promoting a a new economy based on forest preservationWith this, the country intends not only to preserve what remains of the Amazon, but also to influence global environmental policies in the coming decades.
Brazil wants to show its strength at COP 30.
The choice to announce the megafund in Bethlehem, city that will host the COP 30 in 2025It's no coincidence. The government wants to take advantage of the symbolism of the Amazon as a stage for discussions about... future and sustainability.
According to the Ministry of the Environment, the TFFF It's more than a financial measure — it's a A historic commitment to future generations."Protecting the forests means protecting the future of the planet," a government spokesperson stated.
With Tropical Forests Forever Facility, Brazil reaffirms its role as a climate leader. and sends a clear message to the world: the sustainable future It depends on concrete actions, and the country wants to be at the forefront of this transformation.
